physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Mildly elevated calcitonin level of 6.1 ng/liter; normal serum calcium level; normal PTH level; normal 24-h urine levels of catecholamines and metanephrines after total thyroidectomy.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: After surgery, calcitonin values remained normal with no evidence of pheochromocytoma or hyperparathyroidism after 1 yr of follow-up.
